thread.title: Typhoon Kong-rey Unleashes Fury: Southern Korea and Jeju Island Bracing for Up to 250mm of Torrential Rain
thread.title_full: Typhoon Kong-rey Unleashes Fury: Southern Korea and Jeju Island Bracing for Up to 250mm of Torrential Rain

author: newsdirectory3
title: Typhoon Kong-rey Unleashes Fury: Southern Korea and Jeju Island Bracing for Up to 250mm of Torrential Rain
text:
[서울=뉴스핌] Reporter Song Hyeon-do = On Saturday the 2nd, heavy fall rain of up to 250 mm will fall mainly in the southern region and Jeju Island due to the indirect influence of Typhoon No. 21 ‘Kong-rey’.
According to the Korea Meteorological Administration and private weather forecaster K-Weather, the metropolitan area and Gangwon-do will be at the edge of a high pressure system moving eastward from northern China, but the Chungcheong region, southern regions, and Jeju Island will be affected by low pressure passing over the sea south of Jeju Island and will gradually escape.
[사진=뉴스핌DB]
Accordingly, the entire country will be mostly cloudy, and strong rain and wind will hit Jeju Island, where heavy rain warnings and storm warnings have been issued, indirectly affected by Typhoon Kongrey No. 21.
The expected precipitation amount will be 50~150mm in Jeju Island (200mm or more in mid-mountainous areas and 250mm or more in mountainous areas in many places), 5~60mm in Gyeongsang and Jeolla region, around 5mm in Chungcheong region, and 5~30mm in Gangwon region. Especially in Jeju Island, 20mm per hour accompanied by gusts of wind, thunder, and lightning. There are places where there will be very strong and heavy rain of ~30mm.
In most areas of the country, there are places where the wind blows strongly at an instantaneous speed of around 55 km/h (15 m/s), and on Jeju Island, where a strong wind warning is in effect, the wind blows at an instantaneous wind speed of 70 km/h (20 m/s) or more (90 km/s in Jeju Island’s mountainous regions). It will blow very strongly at h (25 m/s or more). There is a possibility that a strong wind warning may be issued on the coast of the Gyeongsang region, so take special care.
The lowest morning temperature is forecast to be 10 to 17 degrees , and the highest daytime temperature is forecast to be 18 to 24 degrees.
The expected lowest temperatures in major regions are ▲Seoul 13 degrees ▲Incheon 14 degrees ▲Chuncheon 11 degrees ▲Gangneung 14 degrees ▲Daejeon 14 degrees ▲Cheongju 14 degrees ▲Gwangju 15 degrees ▲Jeonju 15 degrees ▲Daegu 15 degrees ▲Busan 17 degrees ▲Jeju 19 degrees .
The highest temperatures are ▲Seoul 23 degrees ▲Incheon 22 degrees ▲Chuncheon 20 degrees ▲Gangneung 18 degrees ▲Daejeon 22 degrees ▲Cheongju 22 degrees ▲Gwangju 23 degrees ▲Jeonju 22 degrees ▲Daegu 21 degrees ▲Busan 22 degrees ▲Jeju 22 degrees.
Fine dust levels will be at ‘good’ to ‘average’ levels across the country. Sea waves will rise to 0.5 to 5.5 m across all seas. In the West Sea, South Sea, and Jeju Island, where a storm warning is in effect, the wind blows very strongly at 30~65km/h (9~18m/s), and the waves are very strong at 1.5~5.0m (up to 5.0m or more in the far sea of ​​the South Sea, off Jeju Island). As it rises high, special caution will be needed when sailing or fishing.
dosong@newspim.com
